command: bash -lc 'set -euo pipefail; ts=$(date -u +%FT%TZ); d=$(date -u +%F); dest=/opt/ti/closed/vulnintel/$d; mkdir -p "$dest"; if scp -q -i /etc/ssh/keys/vulnintel_ed25519 -o StrictHostKeyChecking=yes -o UserKnownHostsFile=/etc/ssh/known_hosts_vulnintel -o IdentitiesOnly=yes client@sftp.vulnintel.secure:/clients/acme_corp/advisories/daily.json{,.sha256} "$dest"/ && (cd "$dest" && sha256sum -c daily.json.sha256); then printf "{\"timestamp\":\"%s\",\"technique\":\"T1597\",\"source\":\"vulnintel-secure\",\"artifact\":\"%s/daily.json\",\"status\":\"verified\"}\n" "$ts" "$dest" | tee -a /var/log/ti_fetch.json; else printf "{\"timestamp\":\"%s\",\"technique\":\"T1597\",\"source\":\"vulnintel-secure\",\"status\":\"error\"}\n" "$ts" >&2; fi'
explanation: Retrieves a paywalled vulnerability advisory feed tailored to the target org via SFTP, verifying checksums and producing structured logs, aligning with closed-source reconnaissance.
rationale_steps: Use key-based authentication to the provider's SFTP endpoint.
Download daily advisory JSON and its checksum file.
Record a JSON status line for audit and ingestion.
